3.0: Now you, son of man, take a brick for yourself and place it before you, and engrave upon it a city-Jerusalem.

4.4: So said the Lord God: This is Jerusalem; in the midst of the nations I have placed it, and around it are lands.

20.1: Son of man, set your face southward and speak to the south and prophesy to the forest of the field in the south.
20.6: Son of man, set your face toward Jerusalem and prophesy about the sanctuaries and prophesy about the land of Israel.

21.1: And you, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the city of bloodshed and let her know all her abominations?
21.2: Then you shall say; So said the Lord God: O city that sheds blood in her midst, even now, when her time is approaching, and makes idols over her to defile herself.
21.18: Therefore, so said the Lord God: Because you have all become dross, therefore behold, I gather you together into the midst of Jerusalem.

22.33: And you shall drink it and drain [it], and its shards you shall scrape, and you shall tear off your breasts, for I have spoken, so says the Lord God.

40.6: And it became wider and it wound higher and higher to the cells, for the encompassing of the House went upward round about the House; therefore the widest part of the House was above, and so, [from] the nethermost [cell] one would ascend upon the uppermost one through the middle one.

47.34: All around it amounts to 18,000; and the name of the city from that day will be "The Lord is There."
